p.s: The film The Hate U Give is inspired from the book by Angie Thomas.
Although I think that the book is better than the film, it still had some eye opening points.
In my opinion, the film didn't exactly manage to convey the main factors about the black lives matter problem.

Even if the fight between Starr and Hailey was quite an eye opener because of the facts which Starr said, that you don't have to say the n-word to be racist, the book had more and better points which were left out in the film.
I don't think that the film did a good enough job to prove the points of an african-americanAfrican-American life in the US, because they didn't go into detail of the drug life they have.
It's like they ignored those facts because it isn't child friendly.
But this is the main problem.
They aren't giving the whole picture of their lives and don't acknowledge the most important facts.
The film just touched the surface of the drug problem.
To sum everything up, I would say, that the film could have done it better and focus on the real life problems than a happy-ending which doesn't exist in the real world get.
Even if there were some eye-opening facts in the film.
